post.author: SyncError
post.body:
We are pleased to present the winners of id Software's first Community Map Pak contest. We would like to thank all of our contestants for their time and dedication to the Quake 4 community. It has been a pleasure watching mappers turn up the heat trying to produce some of their best work in a limited amount of time. We were incredibly pleased to have received 34 submissions from 25 map authors and our only regret in concluding this contest is that there are many wonderful levels by talented designers who have not made it into the pak. The CMP will be available soon, distributed inside the upcoming Quake 4 1.4 Beta 2 Patch.

Without further ado, our 15 winning entries:

post.author: Lukin
post.body:
Congratulations to GODLIKE, swelt, Method, killat0n, TymoN, Phantazm11, g0th, Quaker-X, kat, Blushing_Bride and mIKE.

Thanks.

post.author: wviperw
post.body: Congrats guys! Thanks for all the hard work!

post.author: BNA!
post.body: Congratulations from me as well! Great work!

post.author: Kristus
post.body: Congratulations. And, damn, how did I miss this contest?

post.author: zeh
post.body: Congratulations, and also thanks for whoever submitted maps!

post.author: Quaker-X
post.body:
Congrats to everyone! I hope id Software continues this for later games.

Thanks Lukin

post.author: KungFuSquirrel
post.body:
Hey, you did end up in Madison, just across town. nice!

Haven't had a chance to poke around at these yet but looks like there's some good stuff to be found. Looking forward to checking them out; congrats to the winners.

post.author: Tactical Skum Inc.
post.body: Does anyone know how often Id has mappping contests? When should I expect to see the next one?

post.author: kat
post.body: Very rarely is the answer to that.

post.author: zeh
post.body: Yes, I think it was the first time id made something like this.
